summary: Email chain between attorney Bruce Barket and an MCC official regarding an investigation into potential retaliation against inmate Nicholas Tartaglione and media inquiries about Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence shows legal concerns about information leaks and inmate treatment following complaints to the court.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, expressing concerns about false information leaks and retaliation against his client at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of Bruce Barket, an inmate at MCC who was reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein and is the subject of an open investigation regarding potential retaliation by staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a media inquiry about a possible attack on him at MCC, which is the subject of the investigation and media story.

persons.name: Tracy Connor
persons.context: Executive editor at The Daily Beast who emailed Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story about Nicholas Tartaglione being questioned regarding a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal representative for Nicholas Tartaglione, advocating on his behalf regarding treatment and investigation at MCC.
Both were inmates at MCC, with Tartaglione reportedly questioned about a possible attack on Epstein.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Possible Epstein Attack
events.description: Tracy Connor from The Daily Beast emails Bruce Barket seeking confirmation of an NBC story that his client Nicholas Tartaglione was questioned about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

events.title: MCC Official Responds to Investigation Concerns
events.description: An MCC official (name redacted) informs Bruce Barket that there is an open investigation regarding the matter, cautions against sharing information, and states staff have been reminded not to retaliate against inmates.

events.title: Attorney Follow-Up on Client Treatment
events.description: Bruce Barket follows up with an MCC official, noting he met with client Nicholas Tartaglione who reported the official had personally checked on him and swapped his books, prompting thanks.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: An open investigation was ongoing at MCC regarding potential retaliation against inmate Nicholas Tartaglione following complaints to the court.
Media outlets were inquiring about a possible attack on Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, with NBC reporting that Tartaglione was questioned about it.
MCC staff were cautioned not to retaliate against Tartaglione or any inmate during the investigation.
Attorney Bruce Barket expressed concern that false information about his client had been leaked from the facility.
